intro: Pavetta annobonensis, commonly known as the Annobon Island pavetta, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Annobon in the Gulf of Guinea. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories or along stream banks. The leaves are usually elliptical or ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface depending on the variety.
